name: D-Fold
description:
#MadeWithDefold Jam 2022

Controls:

WASD or arrow keys to move

"E", Space or Right Click to use

F10 to open the menu. You can restart a level from there if you get stuck

What's missing:

- The character sprite is just something I made to test a specific lighting shader. I'd like to redo it, add more animations, maybe even some actual graphics, though I have to say I've grown to like the gray blob...

- More levels. There should be at least a couple for each tileset, and there should also be some flatland intermissions as the cube traveller visits different worlds on his search for a way back home.

- Level transitions! I wanted to have two cubes collide whenever you reach an exit, allowing you to enter the new one. Also to have levels with camera inside of the cube. Should be a relatively easy change for a major change of perspective, while keeping the gameplay the same.

- More gameplay mechanics. Hazards, enemies, pushable crates (which may fall on your head if you flip gravity carelessly!). I didn't have time for anything beyond switches and doors, which severely limited my options while making levels.

- Better and more graphics, animations to make the worlds come alive and implementing lightning within the cubes themselves. When I was making the levels, there just wasn't enough time to worry about lightning.

- Fixing the physics. It was a quick job and it's relatively solid, but there's a bunch of quirks still. There's a couple of QoL improvements to make the platforming feel better too.

- Animated starry background for the cube levels. That would be nice.

Credits:

"Future Gladiator", "Hiding Your Reality", "SCP-x2x (Unseen Presence)", "Tenebrous Brothers Carnival - Mermaid", "Voxel Revolution", "Wind of the Rainforest"
